comments.text:
Have you ever been to a night game in a football stadium? If you have the 
chance, go to one because it is the best way to understand this phenomenon. 
If you look up in the stadium, you won't see anything. Even on a clear 
night, the sky looks pitch black. It's because all the huge floodlights are 
on and they're creating so much light that your eye (or a camera) will 
ignore the much dimmer light. The sun acts like a giant floodlight by being 
magnitudes brighter than all the other stars
comments.author: Smithy0013

comments.text:
+Rubricae Actually, the  light from the sun and the reflection of sunlight 
off of the moon's surface is bright enough to obscure most celestial 
bodies. It's much like a day on Earth, where the sun's light is bright 
enough to obscure most of the distant bodies due to the light from the sun 
outshining and our atmosphere reflecting/refracting light. On the moon, 
though, it's the surface of the moon itself and the sun that makes it near 
impossible to see any stars. If you take the sunlight out of the equation, 
you would be able to see the stars just like you would on earth, except 
there would more more of them and it would be much brighter.

comments.text:
Actually our atmosphere absorbs / reflects a lot of the sun's radiation. 
This includes the light it gives off. This is why telescopes in space work 
better. The moon is white and does not have an atmosphere, the astronauts 
have to wear special screens on their helmets that work like sunglasses 
because it is so incredibly bright on the moon due to a lack of atmosphere 
and the moon being white. A similar thing can happen on earth using snow 
called snow blindness because the white snow reflects light and makes the 
area abnormally bright. tl;dr You cant see stars from the moon because its 
really bright on the moon's surface.

comments.text:
+Rene Aensland

Right, the reason he is calling these people "Stupid fuckers" is because 
they support hypotheses that most of the time have very little evidence 
supporting them, or have long since been disproved and yet people still 
believe them.

While I don't condone him calling them "stupid fuckers", virtually all the 
people I've come across who support such ideas do fit my definition of 
"nutjobs" that often get angry at me when I question their views.

I'm not saying you'll be the same, but lets look at hollow earth, something 
that emerged in the 1800s from various unreliable eye witness supports and 
speculative theories, aswell as early sci fi adventures. Now, the hollow 
earth theory can't possibly true, and there are a host of reasons why. 

One of the most central ones, is that we've sent electromagnetic waves 
through the earth, from one side to the other. Now, we can detect the wave 
from the other side of the world, but it's frequency and wavelength will be 
altered, aswell as other qualities. As a result, we can use this to deduct 
the composition of the earth and the varying densities of the earths 
interior. 

And our results do not point to an empty interior, they point to a solid 
earth filled with molten rock, and extremely dense rock at the core.

That in itself is all that is required to denounce "hollow earth" theories 
as complete BS, there is absolutely no evidence for hollow earth, and we've 
literally checked the earth's composition and densities, so yeah.

You may ask me to cite my evidence, but this is something you can literally 
find in a GCSE textbook, and you have google at your finger tips.

And if you're still not convinced, there are a whole host of other reasons 
to why the earth couldn't possibly be hollow, aside from the fact it's a 
rather silly idea in itself. Another example is the earth would not have 
almost no gravitational pull whatsoever if it were hollow, and most of the 
earth's mass is in the core. Hence if we were just a crust, then we'd have 
negligible gravitational attraction.

comments.text:
+Common00Sense
Yes, science and religion are similar systems, though the key principal 
behind science is the scientific method, which is so far, the best rational 
system ever devised by humanity. What separates itself from religion is 
that the scientific method causes scientific theories to constantly 
re-evaluates itself and improves itself, whereas religion is just radically 
conservative (in the sense that it very much resists change, not in the 
political sense)

It's true that science can never actually be truly correct due to the 
inherent level of error in all experiments, (aswell as the uncertainty 
principle), but it's very much like the question, "How long is a piece of 
string?". We can take more and more accurate values of length, but we never 
get to the ultimate length of said string. However, we do get to points 
where it's basically the right length, and science is the same. The more we 
delve, the closer we get to the heart of reality and a fundamental theory 
of everything.

Tis' a beautiful system.

comments.text:
+Jebus LoL Dude, it  costs  billions of dollars to send people to the moon 
and with the lack of public interest in landing on the moon again, it's 
hard to get the proceeds to do so. They're trying to go back there by 2020 
and they're building the Aries series of Rockets to do that job. 

Anyways, prove to me that I'm not right.  Put forth to the table the one 
piece of evidence that 100% says that we didn't land on the moon and we 
faked it? I can give you a list about the length of my forearm of why it's 
NOT faked and, on the very top of that list, it's the Soviet Union's 
silence on the landings that leads the most convincing evidence that it was 
real. If it wasn't real, then the Soviet Union would have called bullshit 
and threw out the evidence to prove their point, but they didn't. 

Then, if you account for the fact that we spent BILLIONS of Dollars in 
order to develop the rockets powerful enough and the equipment necessary to 
actually land on the moon, then why fake it? It would have been a colossal 
waste of  money if it was simply faked. 

Then, most of the things that people use as a counter can be discounted by 
basic understandings of the Lunar atmosphere, gravity, and light 
phenomenon. 

Finally, the most damning evidence to prove the landing theory is the fact 
that we can detect where we had  landed on the moon because we left a 
reflector on the moon that, when fired at by a laser from Earth, we can 
detect a slightly higher spike, which is noticeable compared to the 
background light received, in light received back. This is undeniable 
evidence to support that we had landed on the moon.

captions.text:
• From a moon made of dairy products to
the possibility that the moon doesn't even

exist, we count 15 of the most bizarre theories
ever sprung up about our favourite celestial

body
15 - A Rabbit on the Moon,

• A story begun in Chinese poems that tells
of a rabbit that stands on hind legs in the

shade of a cinnamon tree alongside his toad
friend, pounding herbs to create an elixir

of immortality
• Other cultures had different interpretations

of the same myth, especially in Japan and
Korea where it was believed the rabbit simply

pounded ingredients for a rice cake
• Before the first moon landing in 1969,

the Apollo 11 crew were told to watch out
for a 4000 year old Chinese girl and a rabbit

standing on hind legs, to which Michael Collins
replied,

• "Okay. We'll keep a close eye out for
the bunny girl."

14 - The Moon Doesn't Exist,
• A popular theory that what we're seeing

in the sky is just a fancy illusion, a CGI
projection created after the moon was destroyed

long ago to keep people from going mad
• There have been youtube videos claiming

a power glitch in the moon's artificial electrical
system had it vanish from sight for a few

milliseconds
• If this theory turned out to be true,

it would spell disaster for the astronauts
currently on their way to land on the moon

- oh wait, no, this happened over 40 years
ago, never mind

13 - The Moon Allows Pregnancy,
• Back in early civilisation, people really

didn't know what they were doing - fertility
was believed to be influenced by smoke and

meditation, but many cultures believed the
moon had a huge hand in it

• Since pregnancies came in waves when the
full moon approached, one Assyrian doctor

wrote and based his ovulation charts on the
phases of the moon

• If the moon was in the same phase as that
when they were born, babies would come easier

- gods and deities were based on the moon,
and many hopeless about not being able to

father offspring turned to this belief
12 - The Moon is Made of Cheese,

• A common belief for any that watched Wallace
and Gromit when they were kids, the myth that

we could bring some crackers to the moon and
set up a picnic

• The idea of a moon built of green cheese
first came up in the early 1500s and for a

long time, it was the common belief, especially
in children all the way up to the 1900s

• When kids were asked what else they thought
the moon was made of, most claimed yellow

people, dead people and God
11 - Earth's Shadow Blocks the Moon,

• A surprisingly huge amount of people are
under the belief that when the Earth passes

between the sun and moon, our colossal shadow
causes the phases of the moon

• In reality, the sun always lights up the
moon and Earth barely ever gets in the way

except for during a lunar eclipse - the rest
of the time our rotation just means we can't

see parts of the moon at any given time
• Either that, or the moon cheese just grows

black mould and we need the great cosmic cow
to produce some more so everyone can get pregnant

10 - Civilisations on the Moon,
• A discovery made in 1835, published in

The Sun magazine based in New York, articles
claiming the existence of bison, goats, unicorns,

bipedal beavers and bat-like humanoids roaming
the Moon

• For weeks, New York went into an uproar,
everyone believing the story and some even

donating to charities that wished to send
envoys to the Moon to save the poor, unwashed

Man-bats
• It was only later that people realised

it was all a hoax, a commentary imploring
people not to trust supposed "scientific research"

so seriously
9 - No Gravity on the Moon,

• This is less of a myth and more of a misunderstanding
- people naturally assume, since astronauts

can jump metres high, that there is no gravity
in the moon

• Now, if this were true, nothing would
hold these people on the moon's surface - they

would float away as soon as they landed
• The amount of gravity on the moon is about

1/6th the amount found on Earth, bouncy, but
just enough so you won't float away and end

up in outer space where - believe me - it's
not so great

8 - The Moon is Hollow,
• A spin-off of the old myth about Earth

being hollow, either filled with mole-people
or another universe - but what gave a hollow

moon credence is how similar it appears to
comets and meteors

• The gravitational pull while it spins
around Earth is determined by mass, and a

hollow moon would need a ridiculously dense
crust to achieve the orbit it currently has

• NASA astronaut Neil Armstrong has gone
on record describing sounds from the moon

to ring like a bell, leading many to believe
the claim of a hollow bell-like Moon

• Later research has shown moonquakes there
act different to earthquakes, giving off the

sound of a bell even though the moon is dense
7 - The Moon is a Spaceship,

• Extending the notion of a hollow moon,
two Soviet scientists once hypothesised that

the moon is in fact, a hollowed out spaceship
used by advanced extraterrestrials

• Once again though, astronomers pointed
out that a hollow spaceship planet couldn't

possibly maintain its mass and gravitational
field if the core happened to be dense

• As exciting as the prospect of a local
Death Star may seem, the reality is our moon

is a giant hunk of rock with nothing interesting
on it

6 - The Moon is Filled with Aliens,
• It was in the 1820s shortly before the

report about civilisations of creatures on
the moon that we find a Bavarian astronomer

Franz Von Paula who claimed to have seen aliens
on the moon - with a clear amount more authenticity

than a hollow spaceship full of aliens
• Using sophisticated buildings, forts and

roads, the lunarians as he titled them were
also taken notice by a prominent British astronomer

who made regular observations on the alien
architectural construction

• Then we find out, well, actually, no - the
aliens they thought they saw was actually

moon dust, and the buildings, also moon dust
- big piles of it

5 - Full Moon Promotes Insanity,
• A belief due to the awe-inspiring spectacle

of a full moon that people would turn crazy,
including pets - running wild, crime and hospital

visits increased by a significant degree
• For a long time the myth may have actually

been true, policemen swore criminals got more
rowdy on full moon nights, and even vets reported

they took in more pets around full moon
• In 1985 an official investigation found

that none of it had any basis in science,
it was all pure coincidence - although they

did admit vet visits did increase simply because
more people let their dog outside on bright

nights
4 - Microbes Found on the Moon,

• It was during the Apollo 12 mission that
a camera probe which returned to Earth was

found to harbour a mysterious bacteria Streptococcus
Mitis - to which nobody knew the origin

• At the time, it was generally assumed
some type of sterilisation procedure had gone

wrong, allowing an Earthly microbe to reach
the moon

• In 2007, NASA funded a study to confirm
the breach in sterilisation, and in 2011 three

researchers authored a paper that assessed
the validity of the claim, as well as discussing

the ramifications for future missions
3 - The Moon Changes Size,

• An attempt to explain the different moon
phases in the olden days, the Inuit people

from Greenland that named their Moon god Anningan
• Annigan would chase the sun goddess around

the sky, all the while getting thinner from
malnutrition - leading to the illusion we

know today as the crescent moon
• There's also another modern example known

as Moon illusion, where the moon appears to
get bigger as it descends into the horizon

due to an optical illusion
2 - A Dark Side of the Moon,

• We all know that the moon only ever points
one face towards us at any given time, but

most are under the impression the other side
is darkened since it, y'know, faces the endless

black of space
• In reality the opposite is true - it's

illuminated by the sun just as frequently
as the side we see, it just happens to be

on the other side
• To which only 40% of the moon's surface

is ever "unseen" by us - the moon does turn
in the sky, but only on a slightly skewed

angle
1 - The Moon is a Man's Face

• Whether you know it from the Mighty Boosh,
the Legend of Zelda or the iconic 1902 fantasy

film - a lot of us are familiar with a moon
that has a human face

• But many have drawn diagrams illustrating
such a familiarity, even written songs and

stories based on the fantastic idea
• Many took the lack of spin in regards

to the moon's orbit as proof that it must
be a hologramatic human face lived on by aliens,

bison, microbes, bat-men, cheese, elixir-brewing
rabbits all with the intention on getting

your wife pregnant
• When in reality, it's a giant ass ball
of rock
